ab.title: Genesis 33
ab.l: And Jacob raised his eyes, and looked, and,lo, Esau was coming, and with him four hundred men. Andhe divided the children to Leah, and to Rachel,and to the two maidservants.
And he putthe maidservants and their children foremost, andLeah and her children after, and Racheland Joseph after.
And he himselfpassed over before them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times,until he came near to his brother.
And Esau ranto meet him, and embraced him, and fell on his neck,and kissed him. And they wept.
Andhe raised his eyes, and saw the womenand the children, and said, ‘Who are these to you?’ Andhe said, ‘The children which God has graciously given your servant.’
And the maidservants came here, and their children,and they bowed down.
And Leah also came nearwith her children, and bowed down. And afterwardsJoseph and Rachel came near, and they bowed down.
And he said, ‘For whomis all this camp of yours that I met?’ And he said,‘To find favour in the eyes of my lord.’
AndEsau said, ‘I have many |things|, my brother. What is yoursshall be yours.’
And Jacob said, ‘No, I pray you,if I have now found favour in your eyes,then take my offering from my hand, because I have seenyour face, which is like seeing the face of an angel, and you loved me.
Take, now, my offering that is brought to you,because God had mercy on me, and because I have everything.’ Andhe pressed him, and he took it.
And Esau said,‘Let us journey, and let us go, and let me go before you.’
AndJacob said to Esau, ‘My lord knows that the children are young,and the flocks and cattle beside me are with young. If they press themone day, all the flock will die.

My lord shall pass onin front of his servant, and I will lead oncarefully, according to the gait of the livestock that is before me,and according to the gait of the children, until I cometo my lord to Seir.
And Esau said, ‘Let me now leavewith you |some| of the people that are with me.’ AndJacob said, ‘Why is that? Let me find favour in the eyes of my lord.’
So Esau returned that day on his wayto Seir.
And Jacob journeyed to Succoth,and built himself a house, and made huts for his livestock:therefore he called the name of the place Succoth.
And Jacob came quietly to the city of Shechem,which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Paddan-Aram; andsojourned in front of the city.

And he bought asection of a field, where he had pitched his tent,at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for a seg type="commented" n="#seg022"/hundred qesitahanchor type="commented" xml:id="seg022"/.
And he erected there an altar, and called it El--Elohe-Israel.

app.note: Corrected by another hand into ‘for a hundred lambs’, cf., however, Heb. בְּמֵאָה קְשִׂיטָה ‘for a hundred qesitah’. | TKow.01: ‘lambs’. | H: ‘lambs’. | C: ‘female lambs’.
